chemoreception.notes: As deep-sea limpets, Cocculinidae likely rely on chemoreception to locate food sources in the absence of light. This is inferred from the general biology of deep-sea gastropods.

mechanoreception.notes: Limpets are known to have mechanoreceptors for sensing their environment and maintaining attachment. This is important for their lifestyle.

vision.notes: Vision is not explicitly mentioned and may be reduced or absent in deep-sea limpets.
